1.content:
where decom_date is null and base_category='P'
SELECT
    op_orbit,
    # apogee,
    # perigee,
    bus,
    --name,
    jcat,
    owner.name,
    --state.name,
    length*span as length_x_span ,
    # base_category,
    # heat_color,
limit 10000;
1.name: Active Constellation View (max size - 10000)

2.content:
SELECT
    launch.site.latitude,
    launch.site.longitude,
    launch.org.name,
    jcat.count -> satellites_launched,
HAVING
    launch.site.latitude is not null

;
2.name: Launch Locations

content.query:
def sort(x)-> x.bus_count;

def filter(x) -> x.bus_count >0;

select
    case 
        when count(owner.name)>1 then 'Many (' || count(owner.name)::string || ')' 
        else any(owner.name) 
        end as 
    headline_name,
    case 
        when count(owner.name)>1 then 'N/A'
        else any(owner.location) 
        end as 
    headline_location,
    count(jcat ? decom_date is null and base_category = 'P') as total_satellites,
    count(jcat ? decom_date is not null and base_category = 'P') as decommed_satellites,
    array_sort(array_filter(array_agg( struct(
        bus -> bus_name, count(jcat ? base_category = 'P') by bus ->bus_count
    )), @filter),desc) as per_bus_counts,
    min(launch_date)::string as first_launch,
    max(launch_date)::string as last_launch

;

6.name: Constellation Churn

9.content:
select
    concat(owner.name, ' (', active_satellites::string, ' active satellites)') as label,
    owner.code,
    count(jcat ? decom_date is null) as active_satellites
having
active_satellites>0;
9.name: Note 9
